job_title: Senior Data Engineer | AWS, Equities, Fixed Income | Elite Hedge Fund in Boston
job_text: ['', 'Required Qualifications:\xa0', 'Experience working in Financial Services, ideally supporting performance sensitive fixed income or equities trading', 'In this role, you will design and build cloud-native data pipelines, lakes, and warehouses to massively increase the scale of data that the quantitative research and trading teams are able to leverage. This team has already identified streaming, serverless, and AWS technologies to build initial POCs, but you will have an opportunity to shape the roadmap for additional cutting-edge solutions. This team will support a multi-asset class strategy with a particular focus on fixed income and equities.', 'BS or equivalent degree4+ years of hands-on software development or data engineering experienceExpertise with Python,\xa0SQL/NoSQL and Spark or Hadoop', 'Gain valuable expertise on investment strategies and multi-asset class trading by working directly with quantitative researchers and portfolio mangers', "One of the world's most prestigious Hedge Funds is a small, reclusive firm that has been quietly generating more revenue per head than almost any other firm in the industry. They have a rare opportunity for a strong Senior Data Engineer to join the firm, as they begin building out a new cloud team to redefine the scope and performance of their data processing systems. This team will work in a greenfield environment, designing brand new cloud native solutions and migrating data to AWS.", 'Preferred Qualifications:', 'Leverage streaming, serverless, and AWS technologies to build a next-gen data platform from scratchHelp lead a massive data migration to AWSGain valuable expertise on investment strategies and multi-asset class trading by working directly with quantitative researchers and portfolio mangers', 'Exposure to a major AWS offering (Kinesis, Lambda, EMR, Glue, DynamoDB, Elasticsearch Service, Redshift, Athena, QuickSight, etc.)Experience working in Financial Services, ideally supporting performance sensitive fixed income or equities trading', 'Casual dress, collaborative teams, and work from home flexibility', 'One of the best-rated work cultures and work/life balances in the business', 'Leverage streaming, serverless, and AWS technologies to build a next-gen data platform from scratch', 'Capitalize on:', 'Extremely competitive employee benefits program, 401K, and compensation packageOne of the best-rated work cultures and work/life balances in the businessCasual dress, collaborative teams, and work from home flexibility', 'Help lead a massive data migration to AWS', 'Define the future of high-performance trading systems:\xa0', 'Extremely competitive employee benefits program, 401K, and compensation package', 'Senior Data Engineer | AWS, Equities, Fixed Income | Elite Hedge Fund in Boston', '4+ years of hands-on software development or data engineering experience', 'Expertise with Python,\xa0SQL/NoSQL and Spark or Hadoop', 'Exposure to a major AWS offering (Kinesis, Lambda, EMR, Glue, DynamoDB, Elasticsearch Service, Redshift, Athena, QuickSight, etc.)', 'BS or equivalent degree']

job_title: Talend Data Engineer, Salesforce and/or streaming data integration
job_text: ['Overview', '', ' Knowledge of data formats and ETL and ELT processes in a Hadoop environment including Hive, Parquet, MapReduce, YARN, HBase and other NoSQL databases. ', ' Create / CodeTalend data pipelines for a state of the art analytics applications.  Deploy data processing jobs to production  Configure and setup Talend environments.  Work with stakeholders to identify and document requirements.  Configure and schedule data pipelines  Translate business requirements to technical specifications and coded data pipelines.  Troubleshoot data pipelines ', ' Bachelor’s Degree in MIS, Computer Science, Math, Engineering or comparable major. ', ' Passionate coders with 3-5 years of application development experience with Talend.  Proficiency with Talend Open Data Studio or Talend Big Data is a must. Must have worked on projects that have resulted in code being deployed to production  Salesforce and/or streaming data integration.  Experience with Snowflake, Redshift, or Azure Synapse strongly desired.  Expert knowledge of developing with Talend Cloud.  Knowledge of data formats and ETL and ELT processes in a Hadoop environment including Hive, Parquet, MapReduce, YARN, HBase and other NoSQL databases.  Experience in dealing with structured, semi-structured and unstructured data in batch and real-time environments.  Experience with working in AWS, Azure, and/or Google Cloud environments.  Familiarity with DevOps and CI/CD as well as Agile tools and processes including Git, Jenkins, Jira and Confluence a+.  Client facing or consulting experience highly preferred.  Skilled problem solvers with the desire and proven ability to create innovative solutions.  Flexible and adaptable attitude, disciplined to manage multiple responsibilities and adjust to varied environments.  Future technology leaders- dynamic individuals energized by fast paced personal and professional growth.  Phenomenal communicators who can explain and present concepts to technical and non-technical audiences alike, including high level decision makers.  Bachelor’s Degree in MIS, Computer Science, Math, Engineering or comparable major.  Solid foundation in Computer Science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design.  Knowledge and experience in developing software using agile methodologies.  Proficient in authoring, editing and presenting technical documents.  Ability to communicate effectively via multiple channels (verbal, written, etc.) with technical and non-technical staff. ', ' Salesforce and/or streaming data integration. ['Learn agile methods.', "MotionPoint’s mission is to help brands reach, engage and serve new customers around the world. Our technology and processes solve the operational complexity and cost of website localization. We work with leading brands like AT&T, Urban Outfitters and jetBlue Airways. The real challenge of website translation isn't language--it's technology. MotionPoint's industry-leading approach eliminates the numerous technical challenges, making it effortless for brands to launch and operate translated sites in global markets. We optimize those sites for organic search and user experience, too.", ' ', 'Responsibilities will include hands-on, real-world tasks and projects that will have a direct impact on the ongoing growth of our company:', 'Participate in daily Software Development team standup meetings.', 'MotionPoint is seeking a software engineer intern to work 16 to 24 hours per week for 10 weeks during the spring of 2021 (February 1 - April 9) at our corporate offices in Coconut Creek, Florida. Due to Covid-19, the internship will likely start as remote work and it may convert to onsite work at our corporate office later in the Spring. The intern will report to a development manager. This is an excellent opportunity for individuals interested in Software Engineering careers. Highlights include:', 'Learn how to use version control.Learn agile methods.Use mainstream programming languages in a professional setting (Python, JavaScript, Java, HTML, CSS).', 'About MotionPoint Corporation', 'Create and maintain continuous integration and development processes.', 'Learn how to use version control.', 'Current college students or graduates in Computer Science or Computer Engineering with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.Ability to code in functional or Object-Oriented Programming language. (Python/Groovy/Java).Knowledge of OOP, Data Structures, Unix and SQL.', 'Paid internship with competitive wages of $20/hr.Professional software development work environment.Casual work environment.Open-door management policy.Potential full-time employment.', 'Current college students or graduates in Computer Science or Computer Engineering with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.', 'Potential full-time employment.', 'Participate in development sprint planning and prioritization.', 'Paid internship with competitive wages of $20/hr.', 'Develop code for application in cloud platform using Java, JavaScript and Python.Participate in development sprint planning and prioritization.Create and maintain continuous integration and development processes.Become involved in managing DevOps tools in creating system integration infrastructure in a cloud platform.Participate in daily Software Development team standup meetings.', 'MotionPoint’s technology and processes solve the operational complexity and cost of website localization.', 'Use mainstream programming languages in a professional setting (Python, JavaScript, Java, HTML, CSS).', 'Qualifications:', 'Open-door management policy.', 'Professional software development work environment.', 'About this Job', 'Casual work environment.', 'Become involved in managing DevOps tools in creating system integration infrastructure in a cloud platform.', 'Knowledge of OOP, Data Structures, Unix and SQL.', 'Ability to code in functional or Object-Oriented Programming language. (Python/Groovy/Java).', 'Develop code for application in cloud platform using Java, JavaScript and Python.', 'Learning Objectives:']

['', 'You Get Super Bonus Points For:', 'Solid experience with data-models and sensitive data handling is highly desirable.', 'Be an agent of technological change - learning and evaluating new technologies and making decisions on their adoption', 'You have an intuitive understanding of web frameworks, APIs, cloud infrastructure, information security, and databases, and have worked with multiple programming languages.', 'You can wear multiple hats and work across the stack, both collaboratively and independently.', 'So, what does a typical day look like for a Mission Lane Software Engineer?:', 'At this time, Mission Lane will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position. And please, no third party recruiters.', "You'll be solving some pretty interesting problems, without bureaucratic obstacles.", "You'd also spend some time in the design and development across our web stack and the opportunity to work on or close to our Web, Cloud Platform, Data and Machine Learning teams.", '100% paid health, dental and vision care, a flexible spending account, unlimited PTO, paid holidays, eligibility for our cash incentive plan,', 'Solid experience with Java, Kotlin, Scala, Python, … or equivalent.', "It's that simple.", 'Mission Lane’s Engineering department is looking for a Sr. Software Engineer to join our geographically diverse team. We are primarily based in Richmond, VA and San Francisco, CA, however we are open to considering remote candidates that would be open to travel to our offices on occasions.', 'Solid experience with Java, Kotlin, Scala, Python, … or equivalent.Proven experience with PostgreSQL or equivalent is a big plus.Familiarity with Kubernetes and event-streaming solutions.Solid experience with data-models and sensitive data handling is highly desirable.Deep knowledge of performance tuning, measurement and experimentation systems', "Work cross-functionally with our Product, Design, Credit, Growth and Data Science teams to understand customer needs and how to design and build the most appropriate features or systems that impact the lives of millions of consumers. They're all great people to work with. Trust me!", 'fair and clear', "You'll be solving some pretty interesting problems, without bureaucratic obstacles.Work cross-functionally with our Product, Design, Credit, Growth and Data Science teams to understand customer needs and how to design and build the most appropriate features or systems that impact the lives of millions of consumers. They're all great people to work with. Trust me!You'd also spend some time in the design and development across our web stack and the opportunity to work on or close to our Web, Cloud Platform, Data and Machine Learning teams.Be an agent of technological change - learning and evaluating new technologies and making decisions on their adoptionTime permitting, a little online socializing with your peers.", 'You are both curious by nature and an impressively quick learner.', 'Deep knowledge of performance tuning, measurement and experimentation systems', 'opportunity to make a direct impact in the lives', 'You have a passion for making an impact through technology while building consumer products that make a difference to the lives of traditionally under-served customers.', 'As an employer of choice, Mission Lane believes in our employees the same way we believe in our customers. Our team is always on the hunt for best-in-class talent who bring diverse perspectives and thought to our everyday work. If you are purpose-driven, performance-oriented, and principles-led, you’ll feel right at home here. Do you have an innate desire to push yourself and others to create meaningful impact? Do you have a hunger to constantly learn, stretch, and grow? If so, we invite you to come join us, so we can do amazing things together.', 'You are unfazed by unfamiliar codebases and enjoy figuring complex things out on your own.', 'Time permitting, a little online socializing with your peers.', 'Proven experience with PostgreSQL or equivalent is a big plus.', 'Familiarity with Kubernetes and event-streaming solutions.', 'What qualities do we look for?:', 'You have a few to multiple years of professional experience building software. Bonus points if you’ve excelled at a small, high-growth startup or been working in the fin-tech space or an equivalent highly regulated industry.You have an intuitive understanding of web frameworks, APIs, cloud infrastructure, information security, and databases, and have worked with multiple programming languages.You have a passion for making an impact through technology while building consumer products that make a difference to the lives of traditionally under-served customers.You are both curious by nature and an impressively quick learner.You are unfazed by unfamiliar codebases and enjoy figuring complex things out on your own.You can wear multiple hats and work across the stack, both collaboratively and independently.', 'Mission Lane is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, physical and mental disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/assignment, citizenship, pregnancy or maternity, protected veteran status, or any other status prohibited by applicable national, federal, state or local law.', 'Dedicated to helping everyone have access to fair and clear credit.', 'At Mission Lane, we’re creating an environment that brings out the best in all of us every day. We offer the option of 100% paid health, dental and vision care, a flexible spending account, unlimited PTO, paid holidays, eligibility for our cash incentive plan, in office lunches for employees, the opportunity for career exposure and growth and, most importantly, the opportunity to make a direct impact in the lives of our customers.', 'You have a few to multiple years of professional experience building software. Bonus points if you’ve excelled at a small, high-growth startup or been working in the fin-tech space or an equivalent highly regulated industry.', "Mission Lane LLC is a fin-tech company on a mission (no pun intended!) to help everyone gain access to fair and clear credit. Philosophically, we believe in creating a relationship where everybody wins-- our customers do well when they succeed with our credit cards and we do well when they prosper. It's that simple. Our company is here to provide our customers best-in-class products and service and raise the bar on fair credit access."]

['', 'AI Training and Inference is very inefficient today incurring huge costs with real impact on the environment. We live in the Jurassic era of A.I efficiency and Nod.AI believes we can do much better with a solid focus on our Computer Science fundamentals with first principles thinking. ', 'Experience in deep learning algorithms, frameworks and their Intermediate Representations e.g: Pytorch/GLOW, Tensorflow XLA, LLVM/MLIR, Apache TVM', 'Employ the scientific method to evaluate performance and to debug, diagnose and drive resolution of cross-disciplinary system issues.', 'Bonus if you have experience working on a compiler toolchain codebase, such as Clang, LLVM/MLIR, GCC.\xa0', 'Develop hardware-aware optimization for emerging ML algorithms', 'Work with algorithm research teams to map CNN graphs to hardware implementations, model data-flows, create cost-benefit analysis and estimate cluster or silicon power and performance.', 'Implement and/or enhance code generation targeting machine learning accelerators.', 'Analyze and design effective compiler optimizations.', 'Come work with a high caliber team, where everyone is an engineer first and we guide our decisions with data and celebrate our results.\xa0', 'Responsibilities', 'We enable companies to efficiently deploy Machine Learning models without doing the heavy lifting of optimizing the frameworks and models for their hardware and clusters.\xa0', 'As a Compiler Engineer you will work on design and implementation of significant parts of the Nod Neural Compiler and Runtime. You will work on performance analysis and design/implementation of new optimizations passes and developing new backend targets for custom Accelerators and FPGAs', 'Guru in software design and programming in C++\xa0', 'Experience with compiler architecture, particularly dynamic language compilers or HPC compilers or ML compilers.', '2+ years of experience with an MS or PhD (preferred) in dynamic language compilers or HPC compilers or ML compilers.Experience in code generation targeting machine learning accelerators, GPUs and CPUs e.g: RISC-V', 'Experience in code generation targeting machine learning accelerators, GPUs and CPUs e.g: RISC-V', 'Our A.I Compiler Engineers deliver the best front end for various Machine Learning frameworks like Tensorflow, PyTorch etc and very efficiently parallelize and distribute the workloads onto the Nod Runtime for auto-tuned high performance execution on large clusters and SoCs.\xa0Our ML Systems Engineers effectively deploy compiled A.I models onto a wide range of hardware platforms – from supercomputers with thousands of devices to System-on-Chip designs with hundreds of processing elements (PEs).\xa0', 'Qualifications', 'We live in the Jurassic era of A.I efficiency', 'Contribute to the development of machine-learning libraries, intermediate representations, export formats and analysis tools.', 'Analyze and design effective compiler optimizations.Implement and/or enhance code generation targeting machine learning accelerators.Code using a mixture of Python and C++.Develop hardware-aware optimization for analysis and estimate cluster or silicon power and performance.', '2+ years of experience with an MS or PhD (preferred) in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent field.', 'Code using a mixture of Python and C++.', 'Good understanding of language design, compiler optimizers, backend code generators.', 'Bonus if you have written Compiler optimization passes, done polyhedral optimizations etc .\xa0']

Our mission is to systematize resilience and recoverability across hundreds of services running at massive scale. ['', 'Continuous career development: we actively encourage and celebrate internal promotions', 'About the job', 'As part of the Platform: SuiteScript - Language team, you will have the opportunity to shape the future of the most powerful product on the SuiteCloud platform.\xa0Our mission is to provide a modern, stable, and performant Javascript runtime environment with API access to all NetSuite functionality, enabling customers, partners, and internal teams to build and extend their business applications. ['', 'Clever Perks', 'Sponsor resiliency efforts to achieve 99.98%+ uptime for critical services.', 'Support the needs of the engineering organization enabling them to rapidly deliver new services and deploy their changes with high confidence.Own and scale all the AWS services used by Clever.Develop and operate the build pipeline from GitHub to production.Build monitoring and logging services to ensure the smooth operation of Clever products.Implement tooling for multi-region support and fast failover.Day-to-day work with the CTO on the infrastructure roadmap to support Clever’s business needs.Sponsor resiliency efforts to achieve 99.98%+ uptime for critical services.', 'Experience with AWS Technologies we use is a bonus: ECS (Fargate), Lambda, Glue, RDS Aurora, DynamoDB, ALBs, VPCs, Kinesis, SQS, SNS', 'Unlimited Paid Time Off', "A competitive salary and equity package in a well-funded, high-growth companyUnlimited Paid Time OffTop-notch healthcare, vision, and dental coverage for you and your familyBest-in-class mental healthcare service that supports employees' mental and emotional wellnessUnlimited credits for learning on amazon.com and small, local bookstoresAnnual company retreat and quarterly team eventsAn incredible team of fun, bright coworkers", 'Implement tooling for multi-region support and fast failover.', 'The Clever team works across the full-stack to create products that are robust and delightful for students, educators, and developers to use. Currently, we support teams writing frontend code in Node.js, TypeScript, and React with Redux and Go for backend services. We build tooling and encode best practices across a variety of cloud solutions including MongoDB, Postgres, DynamoDB, Docker, and many AWS services (ECS, Step Functions, etc).', 'Develop and operate the build pipeline from GitHub to production.', 'At Clever, we believe the classrooms we serve and our company’s halls should be spaces that are diverse, equitable, and inclusive. That is why we are committed to building diverse teams, inviting every voice, and creating a safe space for everyone to be their authentic self. By fostering equity and belonging within our circles of influence, we unlock learning for ALL students.', '3+ years of experience as a Software EngineerBackend Engineering ExperienceDeveloped on top of some cloud provider (e.g. AWS)Experience with AWS Technologies we use is a bonus: ECS (Fargate), Lambda, Glue, RDS Aurora, DynamoDB, ALBs, VPCs, Kinesis, SQS, SNSDecision-making skills around choosing the mix of cloud services to leverage in order to reach our goalsThe ability to learn quickly when it comes to understanding and staying up-to-date with cloud services and featuresDesign and product sense for building as an internal infrastructure/platform teamA desire to work in a diverse, fast-paced and highly collaborative team environment', 'A competitive salary and equity package in a well-funded, high-growth company', 'An incredible team of fun, bright coworkers', "Clever is the fastest growing product in K-12 education; depended on by over 600 software companies and over 65% of America's schools. These organizations rely on Clever to put the best software in the hands of over 22 million students every day. Clever's job is to make this task incredibly simple, despite the complex legacies of the school system.", 'Design and product sense for building as an internal infrastructure/platform team', '3+ years of experience as a Software Engineer', "Best-in-class mental healthcare service that supports employees' mental and emotional wellness", '\xa0', 'Decision-making skills around choosing the mix of cloud services to leverage in order to reach our goals', 'Build monitoring and logging services to ensure the smooth operation of Clever products.', 'Unlimited credits for learning on amazon.com and small, local bookstores', 'Backend Engineering Experience', "We're looking for talented engineers who want to help us build Clever into something every school, student, and teacher relies on.", 'Day-to-day work with the CTO on the infrastructure roadmap to support Clever’s business needs.', 'Annual company retreat and quarterly team events', 'A desire to work in a diverse, fast-paced and highly collaborative team environment', 'You may be a fit for this role if you have:', 'You will', 'Things We’re Looking For', 'Developed on top of some cloud provider (e.g. AWS)', 'Own and scale all the AWS services used by Clever.', 'Support the needs of the engineering organization enabling them to rapidly deliver new services and deploy their changes with high confidence.', 'Top-notch healthcare, vision, and dental coverage for you and your family', 'To get a sense of what the Clever engineering team is working on, check out our\xa0engineering blog.', 'The ability to learn quickly when it comes to understanding and staying up-to-date with cloud services and features']

job_title: Senior Software Engineer - Data Partner Integrations
job_text: ['', "Whatever you want—I'm not your boss (I mean I might be!). But seriously anything you can think of that builds on the mandate of The DPI Team is fair game. We're certainly going to plan our work together and we will be working on things which arise from clients and other business areas, but self-directed work is very important to this team.", "College degree in computer science is helpful, but not necessary (my boss has a degree in history or something and he's doing just fine)", "Integrate new data partners into Alloy's platform to meet client needs and help drive strategic growth of Alloy's product", ' Computer Vision and Machine Learning: Erik, an engineer on the DPI Team, is currently using OpenCV (an open-source computer vision library) and TensorFlow (Google\'s machine learning platform) on a project so experimental I can\'t mention it in a public job posting—guess we\'ll have to have a chat if you want to learn more! Custom decisionable attributes: "Attributes" are the core unit of data upon which clients build their custom decisioning workflows, and Calvin is currently in the design phases of a project which will allow clients and/or Alloy Solutions Architects to build custom attributes. This will allow more flexibility in how our clients work with third-party data, which is core to Alloy\'s value proposition. Clients which get the most value out of Alloy\'s platform regularly iterate on their decisioning rules to best meet business needs, and the more flexibility we can give them in tweaking these rules, the better. ', '$500 to just set up your WFH space - a one time thing', 'Git or a similar version control system', "What you're good at", 'Improve observability and reliability of integrations', "Computer Vision and Machine Learning: Erik, an engineer on the DPI Team, is currently using OpenCV (an open-source computer vision library) and TensorFlow (Google's machine learning platform) on a project so experimental I can't mention it in a public job posting—guess we'll have to have a chat if you want to learn more!", 'Maintain and build on existing integrations', " Work history Education history What you're good at What sorts of stuff you enjoy working on Links to whatever you want to show off (GitHub, Twitter, HackerNews, LinkedIn, code samples, etc.) ", "AWS (we do have a dedicated DevOps team but it's good to at least have a passing knowledge of how your code will be running in production)", 'Know your way around a command line', 'Weekly lunch allowance on Seamless', 'Monthly Commuter Budget ', ' 8+ years real world experience. If you\'re coming straight out of bootcamp or the like and can somehow demonstrate exceptional aptitude, then it still may be worth an intro call. But in general I am looking for people who have at least some industry experience. I\'m open to hiring applicants into both the "Software Engineer" level or "Senior Software Engineer" level depending on the needs of the team and what you bring to the table—either way I can promise engineers early in their career an opportunity to learn and grow, and more seasoned engineers an opportunity to put their well-developed skills to good use. While we like to think of ourselves as "platform-agnostic" in our hiring process, realistically it helps top have experience with our tech stack, including: Node.js (the language you\'ll be working in) Experience working with and integrating third-party APIs SQL (Postgres but it\'s really all the same at the end of the day) Git or a similar version control system AWS (we do have a dedicated DevOps team but it\'s good to at least have a passing knowledge of how your code will be running in production) Know your way around a command line Teamwork experience!  College degree in computer science is helpful, but not necessary (my boss has a degree in history or something and he\'s doing just fine) ', 'Company Paid Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits', 'Mentor and learn—you may be just starting out your career and looking for a place which will give you the skills and experience to level up as an engineer, or you may be more experienced yourself and looking for an environment in which your skills will make an impact. Either way we will learn and grow together.', "Node.js (the language you'll be working in)", 'Unlimited PTO and we are remote until 2021*', " Integrate new data partners into Alloy's platform to meet client needs and help drive strategic growth of Alloy's product Maintain and build on existing integrations Improve observability and reliability of integrations Take on projects to level up how we use third-party data at a fundamental level Whatever you want—I'm not your boss (I mean I might be!). But seriously anything you can think of that builds on the mandate of The DPI Team is fair game. We're certainly going to plan our work together and we will be working on things which arise from clients and other business areas, but self-directed work is very important to this team. Mentor and learn—you may be just starting out your career and looking for a place which will give you the skills and experience to level up as an engineer, or you may be more experienced yourself and looking for an environment in which your skills will make an impact. Either way we will learn and grow together. ", ' Unlimited PTO and we are remote until 2021* Company Paid Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits 401k with 100% match up to 4% $500 to just set up your WFH space - a one time thing Annual Professional Development Budget Annual Citi Bike Membership Monthly Commuter Budget  Monthly stipend for groceries from Public Goods Weekly lunch allowance on Seamless Contribution to Lifetime, NYSC, or ClassPass Four Free Therapy Sessions ', '401k with 100% match up to 4%', 'Contribution to Lifetime, NYSC, or ClassPass', 'Experience working with and integrating third-party APIs', 'Monthly stipend for groceries from Public Goods', 'Links to whatever you want to show off (GitHub, Twitter, HackerNews, LinkedIn, code samples, etc.)', 'Annual Citi Bike Membership', 'Take on projects to level up how we use third-party data at a fundamental level', 'Teamwork experience!', 'Annual Professional Development Budget', '8+ years real world experience. I\'m open to hiring applicants into both the "Software Engineer" level or "Senior Software Engineer" level depending on the needs of the team and what you bring to the table—either way I can promise engineers early in their career an opportunity to learn and grow, and more seasoned engineers an opportunity to put their well-developed skills to good use.', 'Work history', 'While we like to think of ourselves as "platform-agnostic" in our hiring process, realistically it helps top have experience with our tech stack, including:', 'Education history', 'Four Free Therapy Sessions', 'Custom decisionable attributes: "Attributes" are the core unit of data upon which clients build their custom decisioning workflows, and Calvin is currently in the design phases of a project which will allow clients and/or Alloy Solutions Architects to build custom attributes. ", 'well, you know. But this seems worth pointing out because, normally, regular in-person interactions play a key role in defining who we are as a team. By regularly having lunch with each other, working together on a whiteboard or computer, taking team bike rides, etc., we foster an environment in which people and relationships come first. But we\'re adapting. We\'re getting creative in maintaining these relationships, and I believe we can do the same to build new relationships with you! So while we are, like most, a remote-first company for now, you should expect the type of culture you\'d normally get at an "in-person" company.']

job_title: Senior Software Engineer Enterprise Trading Network
job_text: ['', '3+ years development experience in C++ or Java', 'Rapidly absorb new technologies while building domain knowledgeLearn to solve for consistency, high availability, disaster recovery, and scalability in a distributed contextBuild high throughput and low latency service-oriented applicationsCollaborate with both product and infrastructure teams throughout Bloomberg', 'A good understanding of concurrent data structures, algorithms, and communication', 'Learn to solve for consistency, high availability, disaster recovery, and scalability in a distributed context', 'Build high throughput and low latency service-oriented applications', 'Strong object-oriented programming skills and familiarity with functional design patterns in C++', 'Familiarity with distributed open-source infrastructure such as Cassandra, Kafka, etc.Familiarity with automated unit, integration, and system testing, particularly in containerized environments', 'Experience in all aspects of software development life cycle', 'Strong verbal and written communication skills', 'Rapidly absorb new technologies while building domain knowledge', 'Familiarity with distributed open-source infrastructure such as Cassandra, Kafka, etc.', "In this role, you will be joining a team that drives the architecture of Bloomberg's integration with internal and external order management systems. Our mission is to design and build leading-edge platforms that are unmatched in the industry. You will be working in an exciting, fast-paced environment where your contributions make a direct impact on the team, product, and global market. Your work will help to shape our infrastructure for many years to come as we transition to better distributed high-performance architectures that deliver speed and reliability by design.", "We are reimagining and rebuilding the core components of Bloomberg's Enterprise Trading Network (ETN) using cutting edge techniques, technologies, and tools.  Our products are next generation platforms connecting thousands of cross-asset class liquidity destinations around the world with global buy-side traders. We are not just looking to build out evolutionary improvements; we're starting a revolution that offers the performance, capacity, and flexibility to take our business in formerly unimaginable directions.", 'Familiarity with automated unit, integration, and system testing, particularly in containerized environments', 'We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.', 'A good understanding of concurrent data structures, algorithms, and communication3+ years development experience in C++ or JavaExperience in all aspects of software development life cycleStrong object-oriented programming skills and familiarity with functional design patterns in C++Strong verbal and written communication skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsBA, BS, MS, PhD in Computer Science, Engineering or related technology field', 'Collaborate with both product and infrastructure teams throughout Bloomberg', 'BA, BS, MS, PhD in Computer Science, Engineering or related technology field', 'Strong analytical and problem-solving skills']

['', 'Why work for EnergyHub?', "Work with the latest technologies: You'll gain exposure to a broad spectrum of IoT, SaaS and machine learning challenges, including distributed fault-tolerance, device control optimization, and process modeling to support scalable interaction with disparate downstream APIs. ", 'Information security experience: PKI, TLS, OAuth, SSO, penetration testing, etc.', 'Collaborate with outstanding people: Our employees work hard, do great work, and enjoy collaborating and learning from each other. ', 'Make an immediate impact', 'Work with the latest technologies', 'Build the advanced grid services that utilities need to evolve the grid to 100% renewable energy', 'Cloud administration experience (preferably AWS + Linux), including instance, networking and security management', 'Contribute to all parts of our stack, from web to our distributed service, queuing, and data layers', 'Collaborate with the analytics team to scale our thermal modeling, device control, and energy efficiency algorithms and incorporate them into new platform features', 'Experience monitoring and operating web services', 'Database and data processing pipeline experience (we work with RabbitMQ, MySQL, MongoDB, DynamoDB, S3, and Airflow)', 'Work with device manufacturers to integrate even more devices into our platform and support new hardware APIs', 'Front end expertise in web (HTML/CSS/React), Android or iOS', 'Demonstrated professional experience with at least one of python, javascript, or java; other programming interests and technologies are encouraged!', 'Experience with at least one scripting language', " Collaborate with outstanding people: Our employees work hard, do great work, and enjoy collaborating and learning from each other.  Make an immediate impact: New employees can expect to be given real responsibility for bringing new technologies to the marketplace. You are empowered to perform as soon as you join the team! Gain well rounded experience: EnergyHub offers a diverse and dynamic environment where you will get the chance to work directly with executives and develop expertise across multiple areas of the business. Work with the latest technologies: You'll gain exposure to a broad spectrum of IoT, SaaS and machine learning challenges, including distributed fault-tolerance, device control optimization, and process modeling to support scalable interaction with disparate downstream APIs.  Be part of something important: Help create the future of how energy is produced and consumed. Make a positive impact on our climate. Focus on fun: EnergyHub places high value on our team culture. Happy hours and holiday parties are important to us, but what's also important is how our employees feel every single day.  ", 'Contribute to our team culture and inclusive workplace environment', 'Be part of something important: Help create the future of how energy is produced and consumed. Make a positive impact on our climate.', 'Make an immediate impact: New employees can expect to be given real responsibility for bringing new technologies to the marketplace. You are empowered to perform as soon as you join the team!', ' Contribute to all parts of our stack, from web to our distributed service, queuing, and data layers Maintain and scale our massive pipeline of streaming device, energy, and weather data Build the advanced grid services that utilities need to evolve the grid to 100% renewable energy Work with device manufacturers to integrate even more devices into our platform and support new hardware APIs Collaborate with the analytics team to scale our thermal modeling, device control, and energy efficiency algorithms and incorporate them into new platform features Contribute to our team culture and inclusive workplace environment ', 'Company Benefits', 'Experience using modern development tools and processes (automated testing, continuous integration, code review, version control, etc)', 'Gain well rounded experience', 'Gain well rounded experience: EnergyHub offers a diverse and dynamic environment where you will get the chance to work directly with executives and develop expertise across multiple areas of the business.', ' 2 - 3 years professional software development experience, preferably in a small to medium-sized team Demonstrated professional experience with at least one of python, javascript, or java; other programming interests and technologies are encouraged! job_title: Software Engineer, Backend, 1+ Years Experience - Seattle
job_text: [' Machine learning and natural language processing ', ' Proven track record of operating highly-available systems at significant scale ', ' Ability to collaborate and work well with others ', ' You evaluate, appropriately test, and debug your work, striving for high quality ', ' We’re looking for a Backend Engineer to join Team Snapchat! As a member of this team, you will design and implement the next generation of Snap’s multi-cloud architecture. Working from our Seattle Office, you’ll collaborate across engineering teams to build some of the most scalable, Tier-0 services at Snap such as our user service and friend graph, infrastructure, monetization and messaging tea. You will also solve exciting distributed systems problems like incremental state synchronization to build our core storage services, used by almost every product at Snap. Finally, you will help the team deprecate our monolithic architecture and move towards a layered service-oriented architecture. ', ' Infrastructure and large-scale system design ', ' Experience with backend services or distributed systems ', 'Snap Inc. is a camera company. We believe that reinventing the camera represents our greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together. ', ' 1+ years of software development experience ', ' Experience with NoSQL solutions, Memcache/Redis, Kubernetes, or Google/AWS services ', ' Work across teams to understand product requirements, evaluate trade-offs, and deliver the solutions needed to build innovative products ', 'Knowledge, Skills & Abilities', ' Experience with Java, C++, and/or Python ', ' Design, implement, and operate our most critical and scalable services - ranging from user identity services, friend graph, and our core persistence layer ', ' Experience with backend services or distributed systems  Experience in at least one of the following areas:  Large-scale microservices and distributed systems  Cloud computing and storage systems  Infrastructure and large-scale system design  Security  Networking and data storage  Machine learning and natural language processing  Tools  Proven track record of operating highly-available systems at significant scale  Experience with Java, C++, and/or Python  Experience with NoSQL solutions, Memcache/Redis, Kubernetes, or Google/AWS services  You can independently execute on medium sized features, taking a few weeks and multiple PRs to complete  You understand the operational aspects of your system and may participate in incident or hotfix investigation and resolution  Ability to collaborate and work well with others ', ' Experience in at least one of the following areas: ', ' Large-scale microservices and distributed systems ', ' Security ', 'What You’ll Do', ' You can independently execute on medium sized features, taking a few weeks and multiple PRs to complete ', 'accommodations-ext@snap.com', ' Networking and data storage ', ' BS/BA degree in a technical field such as Computer Science or equivalent years of experience ', ' At Snap, we believe that having a team of diverse backgrounds and voices working together will enable us to create innovative products that improve the way people live and communicate. Apply appropriate notification to management as appropriate.', '• Train users and less experienced staff on use of lab systems.', 'Job Description: • Create and maintain lab systems by executing the appropriate change management process to support laboratory testing activities and to ensure business, project and/or investigation/CAPA timelines are met.', '• Ability to work on multiple complex projects where independent action and a high degree of initiative are required in resolving problems and developing recommendations.', '• Setup verification testing as appropriate for the lab system.', '• Present information at group/department meetings.', 'Skills/Competencies: • Ability to take initiative and prioritize objectives from multiple projects; adhere to scheduled timelines while maintaining flexibility, independently or as part of a team. Qualified candidates should apply online for immediate consideration.', '• Maintain up to date knowledge on lab system functionality and apply functionality to improve system use and ensure efficient user experience within the systems.', '• Test changes/enhancements through dry runs and receive feedback from lab users, when required.', '• Assist with compiling/tracking team metrics.', 'Required Knowledge/Skills/Qualifications', '• Demonstrated ability to work independently to complete assignments within defined time constraints.', '• Additional experience with laboratory software such as LES, LIMS, MODA, CIMS, etc. and understanding of system interfaces and impact of changes to each other are desired.', '• Ability to interpret and apply cGMPs, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices.']
